Review Text: I underwent a surgical procedure and stayed in BLOCK E and was attended to at the admission reception by Maurício, who explained all the details about how the hospital works and what my stay would be like. I requested an extra meal in the early hours of the morning, as I hadn't had dinner after the procedure, and I was served without any problems.I went back to edit the review, because today, 24 days after carrying out the surgical procedure, I received a billing email informing me that I was late with payment. I found it strange, since I was hospitalized under my health plan, so it wasn't a private hospitalization.At the admission reception, we are given several pieces of paper to sign, including some pages of items that, according to the attendant, some plans do not cover. Values ​​from absorbent to other items. Products with symbolic values ​​from R$0.09 to much higher values.Among all the papers, to finalize your entry into hospitalization, you must sign all of them.When I received a return email from the Hospital's billing area, which I questioned what it was about, I was only informed today, after questioning, that my plan did not offer coverage for leg braces R$ 674.72 + anti sock thrombosis R$ 224.00 + blue magnet box with needle counter R$ 0.01 (yes, charge of R$ 0.01 one cent of reais), totaling R$ 898.73.At no point were we informed that my plan did not offer coverage for these items, much less did they go to the room to speak to my companion or even less upon hospital discharge did the nurse or anyone else inform us about these charges.Ok, the plan does not offer coverage for any item, but the Hospital has an obligation to inform the patient in advance of billing.The amounts they are charging me are relatively “low”, as they are just two items, but there could be a few more digits and there could be other items that the plan would not cover and I would simply be caught by surprise with a charge for something that I was not charged. informed.I was disappointed with the hospital's communication, which until then, I had found everything wonderful and had rated it as a 5, because of that, it dropped to a 3.
